column2: A service that improves the availability and performance of applications by using the AWS global network infrastructure to direct user traffic to the optimal AWS endpoint.

column1: How does AWS Global Accelerator enhance user application performance?
column2: By using the AWS global network backbone and edge locations to accelerate the delivery of traffic.

column1: What type of IP addresses does AWS Global Accelerator provide?
column2: Static Anycast IP addresses that route user requests to the nearest global location.

column1: How does Global Accelerator ensure users are directed only to healthy application endpoints?
column2: It continually monitors the health of your application endpoints and routes traffic only to healthy ones.

column1: What feature of AWS Global Accelerator allows you to control the proportion of traffic that goes to different AWS regions?
